intro: Olmedia rigida, commonly known as rigid olmedia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Olmedia rigida is also valued for its drought tolerance and adaptability to various garden conditions.
